Author: SHossain#0007
Content: Learn Agama, KomodoOceantQT wallet, help users and get 5KMD bounty

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
We would like to encourage our community to help new members in #support  and #deleted-channel channel and optionally on other channels. We will be awarding 5 KMD bounty for the best support cases via our Tipbot. This would encourage users to get a more diverse experience with our tech and products. As a whole, this will build knowledgable and resourceful Komodo community.
Learn, help, spread the knowledge and may the force be with you.

Advice to users:
- Please don't provide or post your private key
- Always keep yourself safe and your data safe
- If you are unsure about anything, please ask
- Using TeamViewer is not recommended and may bring security risk

Author: DavidFLX#2091
Content: Hi. I would like to know if there is any instructions how to run testnet of Komodo on my server?

Author: ca333#0118
Content:
@DavidFLX plz check #kmdlabs or #ask-a-question 
for your info: setting up a fresh assetchain (which is a runtime for of komodo) would be like running a testnet. same base58 prefixes and key format/encoding. only difference is that its solely your own testnet - you can make it public (for the whole community) or keep it private (for your company/lab).

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: https://developers.komodoplatform.com/ guides on this portal might help to start  assetchain from scratch (which can be used as testnet or production chain)

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Does anyone have any suggestion for which open source license to use in this case: Iâ€™m writing some software for someone; I want them to be able to use it freely, do whatever hey want, sell it whatever, but I want to protect myself/retain rights in the event that I ever decide to sell it/use it for my own purposes.

Author: tolken#2655
Content: I basically just donâ€™t want anyone to be able to come after me saying that I stole their code, when I wrote it originally.

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content: @tolken MIT = "weakest" = they need to mention you if they publish

Author: tolken#2655

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Anthony somebody needs to make an official release of komodo and package it up and then submit to debian/ubuntu and then people could do `apt-get install komodo`. Or people can do `apt-add-repository` and use our custom KMD repo, then we don't need it submitted/approved upstream (which takes time)
